title: Emmerdale Nate actor's panic over 'underwater battle' with Cain during stunt week

Emmerdale's Nate Robinson is set for an explosive showdown with Cain Dingle, after his fling with Cain's wife Moira being exposed.

The ITV soap is also lining up a water stunt as the three characters fight for survival, but Nate actor Jurell Carter was initially left panicked by the news.

He explained on Lorraine on Tuesday that he couldn't swim ahead of the scenes, quickly telling bosses ahead of filming for the huge scenes.

Jurell has since had swimming lessons, while Emmerdale storyliner Sharon Marshall confirmed on This Morning that the actor was assisted by divers to help during the underwater scenes.

(Image: ITV)

On the confession, Jurell said: "I couldn’t swim before the storyline came about.

"I spoke to Jeff [Hordley] and he said have you spoken to the production manager. He mentioned the swimming stunt and I said I can’t swim!"

He added: "I think there was a massive panic," to which co-star Natalie J Robb quipped: "Yeah, definitely."

Jurell said after weeks of training with a teacher, he is now able to swim and said the storyline was the nudge he needed.

Sharon, meanwhile, teased what was ahead for Nate and Cain as she spoke of an "underwater battle".

Praising Jurell for his efforts, she told Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford: "Poor Jurell who plays Nate.

(Image: ITV)

"He got the script through for the underwater battle and he had to come and tell us he can’t actually swim."

She added: "He had to learn how to swim. Behind the scenes he was visibly shaking.

"I have so much respect for the guy, we had divers around him and had to get him into the water."

Emmerdale airs weeknights at 7pm on ITV, with an extra episode at 8pm on Thursdays.
description: Emmerdale actor Jurell Carter revealed he couldn't swim before being handed the scripts for his water stunt on the soap
